org.androidtown.sleeper.endclasses

Class clMyDatabaseManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.androidtown.sleeper.endclasses.clMyDatabaseManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    clDataProcessor.clDatabaseManager.IDbChangeListener

    public class clMyDatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements clDataProcessor.clDatabaseManager.IDbChangeListener
    User defined database manage class. It should not directly manipulate SQLiteDatabase object. All user's database manage class should implement clDataProcessor.clDatabaseManager.IDbChangeListener and get SQLiteDatabase object by overriding setDB method. And user defined database manager should only manipulate update, insert, delete when

      • onInsertSummaryTable

        public void onInsertSummaryTable(int rowIndex)
        Called when insertion occurred on clDataProcessor.clDataManager's dataSummaryTable If there's insertion on dataSummaryTable, it means new measurement is started. You almost certainly create create new table of your own for this measurement session. So you should create table here with given rowIndex of row to be inserted on clDataProcessor.clDataManager's dataSummaryTable.
        Specified by:
        onInsertSummaryTable in interface clDataProcessor.clDatabaseManager.IDbChangeListener
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - row index of inserted row in dataSummaryTable.

      • onDeleteSummaryTable

        public void onDeleteSummaryTable(int rowIndex)
        Called when 1 row deletion occurred on clDataProcessor.clDataManager's dataSummaryTable. If there's deletion on dataSummaryTable, it measurement result of certain session is deleted. You almost certainly delete table of that measurement session. So you should delete table here with given rowIndex of row to be deleted on clDataProcessor.clDataManager's dataSummaryTable.
        Specified by:
        onDeleteSummaryTable in interface clDataProcessor.clDatabaseManager.IDbChangeListener
        Parameters:
        rowIndex -
